entry.text: Can't believe I got this job in Denver! For once I feel excited about what's next for me

notes.text: God I look so young here. Crazy to think this is the moment my whole life changed
Showed little Cheryl this picture today. Never noticed Alex off in the background. Wonder what he was up to that day

entry.text: Haven't made many friends yet. Coworkers are all out of town for the holidays. Friends from home are too busy to talk to me. So I'm spending Christmas alone in my tiny-ass apartment

notes.text: I hated it then, but 1500 dollars for a place this close to city center would be a STEAL today

entry.text: Claire left for her dream job today. I wanted to see her off, but I couldn't. It hurts too much, and she looked so happy I didn't want to bring her down.

notes.text: Why didn't I say anything? Why didn't I tell her how I feel. I hate this
Even with how things turned out, I still cry when I think about this day.

entry.text: I should have called ahead, sent a letter, done SOMETHING. But there's no turning back now. I have to see this through, even if it destroys me.

notes.text: I'm headed back home now. No, I'm headed back to St. Louis. Home is back in Denver. With Claire. The least on her place ends at the end of the month. That'll give me enough time to get my things together and scrounge up the money to come back.
It's funny looking at this now. So many black rows, a single red day, and then green for a loooong time. Things really can just turn around sometimes.
